Driver:  I04060720
Service implementation of the Web Service wizards are not filled in with the initial selection.  The user need to click Browse to get the service implemation.  If the user did not do that, they would get:

  java.lang.ClassCastException
      at org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.creation.ui.extension.PreServiceDevelopCommand.execute(PreServiceDevelopCommand.java:102)
      at org.eclipse.wst.command.internal.env.core.fragment.CommandFragmentEngine.runCommand(CommandFragmentEngine.java:413)
      at org.eclipse.wst.command.internal.env.core.fragment.CommandFragmentEngine.visitTop(CommandFragmentEngine.java:353)
      at org.eclipse.wst.command.internal.env.core.fragment.CommandFragmentEngine.moveForwardToNextStop(CommandFragmentEngine.java:251)

Created an attachment (id=38002)
apply to org.eclipse.jst.ws.creation.ui

patch 1 of 1 to fix the service wizard

The attached patch is ready to be committed. It fixes object selection defaulting in the Web service wizard. I will attach patches for the client wizard separately. It probably makes sense to go ahead and commit this patch now and rather than waiting for the client wizard piece of the fix. If you do commit/release this patch now, please leave this bug in ASSIGNED state.
Patch for fixing the service wizard has been reviewed, tested and committed.  I will be released for next week's integration driver.
Patch committed and released as v200604072208.  Leaving in Assign state for the fix to the Client wizard.
